results.description: David Fekke will present on Socket.IO at the March Node.js meeting. Socket.IO is a Javascript library for realtime communication between the Server and the Browser. Socket.IO can use Websockets to maintain an always on connection between the Server and Browser, but will also use lesser technologies if Websockets are not available.

results.description:
Hello Dear Potential Attendee! Welcome to your opportunity to learn all about SQL Server! Come join SQL MVP Jorge Segarra and SQL Server DBA Bradley Ball for a full day of Performance Tuning. There is a lot to cover and a lot to learn. 


Introduction


Congratulations! You’ve got a Server – The first thing that you have to learn in Troubleshooting is how to ask the questions. We have two types of systems we will maintain. Those we see every day and those we have just discovered because of a problem thats been brought to our attention. There are questions we ask every day when we have the luxury of time and there are questions we ask quickly to figure out what’s going on. • Topics Covered: Baselines, Waits and Queues, Extended Events, Error Logs, DMV’s

Configuration & Best Practices


As Consultants a lot of the problems that we see are caused because the system has not been configured properly. There are things to configure for the Hardware, things to configure for the OS, things to configure AFTER you’ve installed SQL Server. We’ll discuss not just how you should set things, but why!

Topics Covered: Hardware (CPU, Memory, Physical Disk), Pre Configuration Checklist (Instant Database File Initialization, Service Account rights, OS Patching, Power Configuration), Post Configuration Checklist (Tempdb, Max Memory, Max DOP, Affinity, NUMA, Trace Flags).

Indexes, the Optimizer, and the Plan Cache


When it comes to making your queries run you need to understand how SQL Server reads a query and how the Optimizer works and return our physical data. Physical data is stored in structures such as tables and indexes, and understanding how to structure tables and indexes to work with our queries is critical. But what ties the Optimizer to the physical structures is the query plan. To find the query plan we’ll dive into the plan cache and cover query tuning from A to Z.

Topics Covered: Query Optimizer, Indexes, Page Splits, Plan Cache, Execution Plans and operators.

Locking, Blocking, Deadlocks, Latches, and Spinlocks 

This topic sounds scary, but it’s not. Regardless of whether you have a small database with only a few users, or if you have a large multi-tenant system you have Locking, Blocking, Latches, and Spinlocks. Understanding what they are and how they work is the first step in understanding how to troubleshoot them. Deadlocks are a problem, but they are a problem we can fix. In this module we will explain and investigate how to find and fix the problems that we see in our database every day.

Topics Covered: Locking, Blocking, Deadlocks, Latches, and Spinlocks.
results.name: Full Day Performance Tuning Pre-con

results.description:
Attending?

The very first batch of tickets will go on sale Monday December 16th. While there will be more tickets available than ever, they will sell out fast. Make sure you know the details and have made the necessary arrangements!

Speaking?

Our call for speakers will remain open until Friday, January 10th, 2014 at 12:00PM EST. We strive every year to push the boundaries of what is possible with JS by spotlighting the future of the language and those making that future a reality.

Sponsoring?

We do things a little different. There are no booths, no exhibit halls, and we encourage you to send your best technical talent. We focus on creating amazing shared experiences, which have far broader and longer lasting effects.

Visit their <a>website</a> for more information.
results.name: JSConf 2014

venue.name: Florida State College at Jacksonville Downtown Campus

results.description:
Location: 


FSCJ Downtown Campus
Advanced Technology Center (ATC)

(Room T-112) 
101 W. State Street, Jacksonville, FL 32202

TekSystems is providing
breakfast: Panera
lunch: Angie's Subs 

Nokia US and DVLUP providing free swag and giveaways


Guest  speaker(s) TBA


Come learn new tips and tricks for developing award winning Windows 8 and Windows Phone 8 apps  

breakfast, lunch and afternoon coffee will be provided  

This will be a hands-on hackathon so be sure to bring your laptop preconfigured with Visual Studio 2013, including the Windows Phone SDK.



------- IMPORTANT DETAILS AND HACKATHON RULES -------

This hackathon is themed around the challenges on DVLUP.com, a free rewards program site run by Nokia for Windows Phone developers. On DVLUP.com you earn experience points (XP) by completing challenges and then can redeem these XP for prizes, everything from Windows Phone swag to Amazon gift cards to Nokia Lumia phones.

At the hackathon, you will be provided with a handful of app challenges to choose from, hand picked by the event organizers because they should be able to be completed or mostly completed in a day. Sample code and other resources will be provided, along with expert help from mentors. These challenges will include but are not limited to apps that use NFC communications, Nokia Maps, and the phone's camera.


So what can you walk away with by participating in this event? 


we will have DVLUP giveaways for registered geeks and special prizes for apps published within 2 weeks



What do I need to bring?


Bring your own Windows 8 laptop if possible. There will be a very limited number of systems available if you do not have this, but not nearly enough for everyone. Please let us know in advance if you need access to a PC.

Most but not all DVLUP challenges require the app be developed for Windows Phone 8. Unfortunately the Windows Phone 8 development tools only run on Windows 8 (64 bit) systems. You will need the Windows Phone 8 SDK installed, and it is highly recommended you do this ahead of time, download here http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35471

If you don't have a Windows 8 machine, all is not lost. If you have Windows 7 or Vista you can develop apps for Windows Phone 7. You will be limited in the challenges you can develop for, but will still qualify for all of the promotions. Please install the Windows Phone 7.1 SDK ahead of time, link: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=27570
results.name: DVLUP Day Jax hackathon +UX Designers Welcome

meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
